description.narrative: Output 7.4: Increased national capacity to generate and utilize data and knowledge on key human rights and gender equality dimensions of social inclusion., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 7: Improved policy environment and systems for disadvantaged and excluded children, guided by improved knowledge and data.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF PUBLIC SERVICE LABOUR AND SOCIAL WELFARE

sector.narrative: Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 7.4: Increased national capacity to generate and utilize data and knowledge on key human rights and gender equality dimensions of social inclusion.

description.narrative: In 2019 UNICEF partnered with the Zimbabwe National Statistics Agency (ZIMSTAT) and implemented the Multiple Indicator Cluster Survey (MICS) 2019. UNICEF and ZIMSTAT also produced the first ever Monetary Child Poverty Report and a Poverty Atlas through a secondary analysis of the Poverty Income Consumption and Expenditure Survey (PICES) 2017. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/07/2019
